If you're interested in a different take on cinema history, "Hitch" might be worth checking out too. It explores the legendary meeting between Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut, offering a fascinating insight into their conversation.

Alternatively, if you're intrigued by the suspenseful plot, you might also enjoy "Taken" (2008) starring Liam Neeson. It's about a retired CIA agent who embarks on a mission to save his daughter from kidnappers in Paris. Both films offer thrilling narratives that I believe you would find engaging.
